00024     import json

00029 
00030 class DataEncoder(json.JSONEncoder):
00031     """
00032     Custom json encoder for objects derived form ILsmData
00033     """
00034 
00035     def default(self, my_class):
00036         if not isinstance(my_class, IData):
00037             raise ValueError('incorrect class type:' + str(type(my_class)))
00038         else:
00039             return my_class._to_dict()
00040 
00041 
00042 class DataDecoder(json.JSONDecoder):
00043     """
00044     Custom json decoder for objects derived from ILsmData
00045     """
00046 
00047     @staticmethod
00048     def __process_dict(d):
00049         """
00050         Processes a dictionary
00051         """
00052         rc = {}
00053 
00054         if 'class' in d:
00055             rc = IData._factory(d)
00056         else:
00057             for (k, v) in d.iteritems():
00058                 rc[k] = DataDecoder.__decode(v)
00059 
00060         return rc
00061 
00062     @staticmethod
00063     def __process_list(l):
00064         """
00065         Processes a list
00066         """
00067         rc = []
00068         for elem, value in enumerate(l):
00069             if type(value) is list:
00070                 rc.append(DataDecoder.__process_list(value))
00071             elif type(value) is dict:
00072                 rc.append(DataDecoder.__process_dict(value))
00073             else:
00074                 rc.append(value)
00075         return rc
00076 
00077     @staticmethod
00078     def __decode(e):
00079         """
00080         Decodes the parsed json
00081         """
00082         if type(e) is dict:
00083             return DataDecoder.__process_dict(e)
00084         elif type(e) is list:
00085             return DataDecoder.__process_list(e)
00086         else:
00087             return e
00088 
00089     def decode(self, json_string, _w=WHITESPACE.match):
00090         return DataDecoder.__decode(json.loads(json_string))
00091 
00092 
00093 class IData(object):
00094     """
00095     Base class functionality of serializable
00096     classes.
00097     """
00098     __metaclass__ = _ABCMeta
00099 
00100     def _to_dict(self):
00101         """
00102         Represent the class as a dictionary
00103         """
00104         rc = {'class': self.__class__.__name__}
00105 
00106         #If one of the attributes is another IData we will
00107         #process that too, is there a better way to handle this?
00108         for (k, v) in self.__dict__.items():
00109             if isinstance(v, IData):
00110                 rc[k[1:]] = v._to_dict()
00111             else:
00112                 rc[k[1:]] = v
00113 
00114         return rc
00115 
00116     @staticmethod
00117     def _factory(d):
00118         """
00119         Factory for creating the appropriate class given a dictionary.
00120         This only works for objects that inherit from IData
00121         """
00122         if 'class' in d:
00123             class_name = d['class']
00124             del d['class']
00125             c = get_class(__name__ + '.' + class_name)
00126 
00127             #If any of the parameters are themselves an IData process them
00128             for k, v in d.items():
00129                 if isinstance(v, dict) and 'class' in v:
00130                     d['_' + k] = IData._factory(d.pop(k))
00131                 else:
00132                     d['_' + k] = d.pop(k)
00133 
00134             return c(**d)
00135 
00136     def __str__(self):
00137         """
00138         Used for human string representation.
00139         """
00140         return str(self._to_dict())
00141 
00142 
00143 @default_property('id', doc="Unique identifier")
00144 @default_property('name', doc="Disk name (aka. vendor)")
00145 @default_property('disk_type', doc="Enumerated type of disk")
00146 @default_property('block_size', doc="Size of each block")
00147 @default_property('num_of_blocks', doc="Total number of blocks")
00148 @default_property('status', doc="Enumerated status")
00149 @default_property('system_id', doc="System identifier")
00150 @default_property("plugin_data", doc="Private plugin data")
00151 class Disk(IData):
00152     """
00153     Represents a disk.
00154     """
00155     SUPPORTED_SEARCH_KEYS = ['id', 'system_id']
00156 
00157     # We use '-1' to indicate we failed to get the requested number.
00158     # For example, when block found is undetectable, we use '-1' instead of
00159     # confusing 0.
00160     BLOCK_COUNT_NOT_FOUND = -1
00161     BLOCK_SIZE_NOT_FOUND = -1
00162 
00163     TYPE_UNKNOWN = 0
00164     TYPE_OTHER = 1
00165     TYPE_ATA = 3     # IDE disk which is seldomly used.
00166     TYPE_SATA = 4
00167     TYPE_SAS = 5
00168     TYPE_FC = 6
00169     TYPE_SOP = 7     # SCSI over PCIe(SSD)
00170     TYPE_SCSI = 8
00171     TYPE_LUN = 9   # Remote LUN was treated as a disk.
00172 
00173     # Due to complesity of disk types, we are defining these beside DMTF
00174     # standards:
00175     TYPE_NL_SAS = 51    # Near-Line SAS==SATA disk + SAS port.
00176 
00177     # in DMTF CIM 2.34.0+ CIM_DiskDrive['DiskType'], they also defined
00178     # SSD and HYBRID disk type. We use it as faillback.
00179     TYPE_HDD = 52    # Normal HDD
00180     TYPE_SSD = 53    # Solid State Drive
00181     TYPE_HYBRID = 54    # uses a combination of HDD and SSD
00182 
00183     STATUS_UNKNOWN = 1 << 0
00184     STATUS_OK = 1 << 1
00185     STATUS_OTHER = 1 << 2
00186     STATUS_PREDICTIVE_FAILURE = 1 << 3
00187     STATUS_ERROR = 1 << 4
00188     STATUS_REMOVED = 1 << 5
00189     STATUS_STARTING = 1 << 6
00190     STATUS_STOPPING = 1 << 7
00191     STATUS_STOPPED = 1 << 8
00192     STATUS_INITIALIZING = 1 << 9
00193     STATUS_MAINTENANCE_MODE = 1 << 10
00194     # In maintenance for bad sector scan, integerity check and etc
00195     # It might be combined with STATUS_OK or
00196     # STATUS_STOPPED for online maintenance or offline maintenance.
00197     STATUS_SPARE_DISK = 1 << 11
00198     # Indicate disk is a spare disk.
00199     STATUS_RECONSTRUCT = 1 << 12
00200     # Indicate disk is reconstructing data.
00201     STATUS_FREE = 1 << 13
00202     # New in version 1.2, indicate the whole disk is not holding any data or
00203     # acting as a dedicate spare disk.
00204     # This disk could be assigned as a dedicated spare disk or used for
00205     # creating pool.
00206     # If any spare disk(like those on NetApp ONTAP) does not require
00207     # any explicit action when assigning to pool, it should be treated as
00208     # free disk and marked as STATUS_FREE|STATUS_SPARE_DISK.
00209 
00210     def __init__(self, _id, _name, _disk_type, _block_size, _num_of_blocks,
00211                  _status, _system_id, _plugin_data=None):
00212         self._id = _id
00213         self._name = _name
00214         self._disk_type = _disk_type
00215         self._block_size = _block_size
00216         self._num_of_blocks = _num_of_blocks
00217         self._status = _status
00218         self._system_id = _system_id
00219         self._plugin_data = _plugin_data
00220 
00221     @property
00222     def size_bytes(self):
00223         """
00224         Disk size in bytes.
00225         """
00226         return self.block_size * self.num_of_blocks
00227 
00228     def __str__(self):
00229         return self.name

00232 # Lets do this once outside of the class to minimize the number of
00233 # times it needs to be compiled.
00234 _vol_regex_vpd83 = re.compile('(?:^6[0-9a-f]{31})|(?:^[235][0-9a-f]{15})$')

00237 @default_property('id', doc="Unique identifier")
00238 @default_property('name', doc="User given name")

00246 class Volume(IData):
00247     """
00248     Represents a volume.
00249     """
00250     SUPPORTED_SEARCH_KEYS = ['id', 'system_id', 'pool_id']
00251 
00252     #Replication types
00253     REPLICATE_UNKNOWN = -1
00254     REPLICATE_CLONE = 2
00255     REPLICATE_COPY = 3
00256     REPLICATE_MIRROR_SYNC = 4
00257     REPLICATE_MIRROR_ASYNC = 5
00258 
00259     #Provisioning types
00260     PROVISION_UNKNOWN = -1
00261     PROVISION_THIN = 1
00262     PROVISION_FULL = 2
00263     PROVISION_DEFAULT = 3
00264 
00265     ADMIN_STATE_DISABLED = 0
00266     ADMIN_STATE_ENABLED = 1
00267 
00268     RAID_TYPE_UNKNOWN = -1
00269     # The plugin failed to detect the volume's RAID type.
00270     RAID_TYPE_RAID0 = 0
00271     # Stripe
00272     RAID_TYPE_RAID1 = 1
00273     # Mirror for two disks. For 4 disks or more, they are RAID10.
00274     RAID_TYPE_RAID3 = 3
00275     # Byte-level striping with dedicated parity
00276     RAID_TYPE_RAID4 = 4
00277     # Block-level striping with dedicated parity
00278     RAID_TYPE_RAID5 = 5
00279     # Block-level striping with distributed parity
00280     RAID_TYPE_RAID6 = 6
00281     # Block-level striping with two distributed parities, aka, RAID-DP
00282     RAID_TYPE_RAID10 = 10
00283     # Stripe of mirrors
00284     RAID_TYPE_RAID15 = 15
00285     # Parity of mirrors
00286     RAID_TYPE_RAID16 = 16
00287     # Dual parity of mirrors
00288     RAID_TYPE_RAID50 = 50
00289     # Stripe of parities
00290     RAID_TYPE_RAID60 = 60
00291     # Stripe of dual parities
00292     RAID_TYPE_RAID51 = 51
00293     # Mirror of parities
00294     RAID_TYPE_RAID61 = 61
00295     # Mirror of dual parities
00296     RAID_TYPE_JBOD = 20
00297     # Just bunch of disks, no parity, no striping.
00298     RAID_TYPE_MIXED = 21
00299     # This volume contains multiple RAID settings.
00300     RAID_TYPE_OTHER = 22
00301     # Vendor specific RAID type
00302 
00303     STRIP_SIZE_UNKNOWN = 0
00304     DISK_COUNT_UNKNOWN = 0
00305     MIN_IO_SIZE_UNKNOWN = 0
00306     OPT_IO_SIZE_UNKNOWN = 0
00307 
00308     VCR_STRIP_SIZE_DEFAULT = 0
00309 
00310     def __init__(self, _id, _name, _vpd83, _block_size, _num_of_blocks,
00311                  _admin_state, _system_id, _pool_id, _plugin_data=None):
00312         self._id = _id                        # Identifier
00313         self._name = _name                    # Human recognisable name
00314         if _vpd83 and not Volume.vpd83_verify(_vpd83):
00315             raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
00316                            "Incorrect format of VPD 0x83 NAA(3) string: '%s', "
00317                            "expecting 32 or 16 lower case hex characters" %
00318                            _vpd83)
00319         self._vpd83 = _vpd83                  # SCSI page 83 unique ID
00320         self._block_size = _block_size        # Block size
00321         self._num_of_blocks = _num_of_blocks  # Number of blocks
00322         self._admin_state = _admin_state      # enable or disabled by admin
00323         self._system_id = _system_id          # System id this volume belongs
00324         self._pool_id = _pool_id              # Pool id this volume belongs
00325         self._plugin_data = _plugin_data
00326 
00327     @property
00328     def size_bytes(self):
00329         """
00330         Volume size in bytes.
00331         """
00332         return self.block_size * self.num_of_blocks
00333 
00334     def __str__(self):
00335         return self.name
00336 
00337     @staticmethod
00338     def vpd83_verify(vpd):
00339         """
00340         Returns True if string is valid vpd 0x83 representation
00341         """
00342         if vpd and _vol_regex_vpd83.match(vpd):
00343             return True
00344         return False

00368 @default_property('id', doc="Unique identifier")
00369 @default_property('name', doc="User supplied name")
00370 @default_property('total_space', doc="Total space in bytes")
00371 @default_property('free_space', doc="Free space in bytes")
00372 @default_property('status', doc="Enumerated status")
00373 @default_property('status_info', doc="Text explaining status")
00374 @default_property('system_id', doc="System identifier")
00375 @default_property("plugin_data", doc="Plug-in private data")
00376 @default_property("element_type", doc="What pool can be used for")
00377 @default_property("unsupported_actions",
00378                   doc="What cannot be done with this pool")
00379 class Pool(IData):
00380     """
00381     Pool specific information
00382     """
00383     SUPPORTED_SEARCH_KEYS = ['id', 'system_id']
00384 
00385     TOTAL_SPACE_NOT_FOUND = -1
00386     FREE_SPACE_NOT_FOUND = -1
00387 
00388     # Element Type indicate what kind of element could this pool create:
00389     #   * Another Pool
00390     #   * Volume (aka, LUN)
00391     #   * System Reserved Pool.
00392     ELEMENT_TYPE_POOL = 1 << 1
00393     ELEMENT_TYPE_VOLUME = 1 << 2
00394     ELEMENT_TYPE_FS = 1 << 3
00395     ELEMENT_TYPE_DELTA = 1 << 4
00396     ELEMENT_TYPE_VOLUME_FULL = 1 << 5
00397     ELEMENT_TYPE_VOLUME_THIN = 1 << 6
00398     ELEMENT_TYPE_SYS_RESERVED = 1 << 10     # Reserved for system use
00399 
00400     # Unsupported actions, what pool cannot be used for
00401     UNSUPPORTED_VOLUME_GROW = 1 << 0
00402     UNSUPPORTED_VOLUME_SHRINK = 1 << 1
00403 
00404     # Pool status could be any combination of these status.
00405     STATUS_UNKNOWN = 1 << 0
00406     STATUS_OK = 1 << 1
00407     STATUS_OTHER = 1 << 2
00408     STATUS_DEGRADED = 1 << 4
00409     STATUS_ERROR = 1 << 5
00410     STATUS_STOPPED = 1 << 9
00411     STATUS_RECONSTRUCTING = 1 << 12
00412     STATUS_VERIFYING = 1 << 13
00413     STATUS_INITIALIZING = 1 << 14
00414     STATUS_GROWING = 1 << 15
00415 
00416     MEMBER_TYPE_UNKNOWN = 0
00417     MEMBER_TYPE_OTHER = 1
00418     MEMBER_TYPE_DISK = 2
00419     MEMBER_TYPE_POOL = 3
00420 
00421     def __init__(self, _id, _name, _element_type, _unsupported_actions,
00422                  _total_space, _free_space,
00423                  _status, _status_info, _system_id, _plugin_data=None):
00424         self._id = _id                      # Identifier
00425         self._name = _name                  # Human recognisable name
00426         self._element_type = _element_type  # What pool can be used to create
00427         self._unsupported_actions = _unsupported_actions  # What pool cannot be
00428                                             # used for
00429         self._total_space = _total_space    # Total size
00430         self._free_space = _free_space      # Free space available
00431         self._status = _status              # Status of pool.
00432         self._status_info = _status_info    # Additional status text of pool
00433         self._system_id = _system_id        # System id this pool belongs
00434         self._plugin_data = _plugin_data    # Plugin private data

00471 @default_property('id', doc="Unique identifier")

00515 @default_property('id', doc="Unique instance identifier")
00516 @default_property('name', doc="Access group name")
00517 @default_property('init_ids', doc="List of initiator IDs")
00518 @default_property('init_type', doc="Initiator type")
00519 @default_property('system_id', doc="System identifier")
00520 @default_property('plugin_data', doc="Plugin private data")
00521 class AccessGroup(IData):
00522     SUPPORTED_SEARCH_KEYS = ['id', 'system_id']
00523 
00524     INIT_TYPE_UNKNOWN = 0
00525     INIT_TYPE_OTHER = 1
00526     INIT_TYPE_WWPN = 2
00527     INIT_TYPE_ISCSI_IQN = 5
00528     INIT_TYPE_ISCSI_WWPN_MIXED = 7
00529 
00530     def __init__(self, _id, _name, _init_ids, _init_type, _system_id,
00531                  _plugin_data=None):
00532         self._id = _id
00533         self._name = _name                # AccessGroup name
00534         self._init_ids = AccessGroup._standardize_init_list(_init_ids)
00535                                           # A list of Initiator ID strings.
00536         self._init_type = _init_type
00537         self._system_id = _system_id      # System id this group belongs
00538         self._plugin_data = _plugin_data
00539 
00540     @staticmethod
00541     def _standardize_init_list(init_ids):
00542         rc = []
00543         for i in init_ids:
00544             valid, init_type, init_id = AccessGroup.initiator_id_verify(i)
00545 
00546             if valid:
00547                 rc.append(init_id)
00548             else:
00549                 raise LsmError(LsmError.ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
00550                                "Invalid initiator ID %s" % i)
00551         return rc
00552 
00553     _regex_wwpn = re.compile(r"""
00554         ^(0x|0X)?([0-9A-Fa-f]{2})
00555         (([\.:\-])?[0-9A-Fa-f]{2}){7}$
00556         """, re.X)
00557 
00558     @staticmethod
00559     def initiator_id_verify(init_id, init_type=None, raise_exception=False):
00560         """
00561         Public method which can be used to verify an initiator id
00562         :param init_id:
00563         :param init_type:
00564         :param raise_exception: Will throw a LsmError INVALID_ARGUMENT if
00565                                 not a valid initiator address
00566         :return:(Bool, init_type, init_id)  Note: init_id will be returned in
00567                 normalized format if it's a WWPN
00568         """
00569         if init_id.startswith('iqn') or init_id.startswith('eui') or\
00570                 init_id.startswith('naa'):
00571 
00572             if init_type is None or \
00573                     init_type == AccessGroup.INIT_TYPE_ISCSI_IQN:
00574                 return True, AccessGroup.INIT_TYPE_ISCSI_IQN, init_id
00575         if AccessGroup._regex_wwpn.match(str(init_id)):
00576             if init_type is None or \
00577                     init_type == AccessGroup.INIT_TYPE_WWPN:
00578                 return (True, AccessGroup.INIT_TYPE_WWPN,
00579                         AccessGroup._wwpn_to_lsm_type(init_id))
00580 
00581         if raise_exception:
00582             raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
00583                            "Initiator id '%s' is invalid" % init_id)
00584 
00585         return False, None, None
00586 
00587     @staticmethod
00588     def _wwpn_to_lsm_type(wwpn, raise_error=True):
00589         """
00590         Conver provided WWPN string into LSM standarded one:
00591 
00592         LSM WWPN format:
00593             ^(?:[0-9a-f]{2}:){7}[0-9a-f]{2}$
00594         LSM WWPN Example:
00595            10:00:00:00:c9:95:2f:de
00596 
00597         Acceptable WWPN format is:
00598             ^[0x|0X]{0,1}(:?[0-9A-Fa-f]{2}[\.\-:]{0,1}){7}[0-9A-Fa-f]{2}$
00599         Acceptable WWPN example:
00600            10:00:00:00:c9:95:2f:de
00601            10:00:00:00:C9:95:2F:DE
00602            10-00-00-00-C9-95-2F-DE
00603            10-00-00-00-c9-95-2f-de
00604            10.00.00.00.C9.95.2F.DE
00605            10.00.00.00.c9.95.2f.de
00606            0x10000000c9952fde
00607            0X10000000C9952FDE
00608            10000000c9952fde
00609            10000000C9952FDE
00610         Return the LSM WWPN
00611         Return None if raise_error is False and not a valid WWPN.
00612         """
00613         if AccessGroup._regex_wwpn.match(str(wwpn)):
00614             s = str(wwpn)
00615             s = s.lower()
00616             s = re.sub(r'0x', '', s)
00617             s = re.sub(r'[^0-9a-f]', '', s)
00618             s = ":".join(re.findall(r'..', s))
00619             return s
00620         if raise_error:
00621             raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
00622                            "Invalid WWPN Initiator: %s" % wwpn)
00623         return None
00624 
00625 
00626 @default_property('id', doc="Unique instance identifier")
00627 @default_property('port_type', doc="Target port type")
00628 @default_property('service_address', doc="Target port service address")
00629 @default_property('network_address', doc="Target port network address")
00630 @default_property('physical_address', doc="Target port physical address")
00631 @default_property('physical_name', doc="Target port physical port name")
00632 @default_property('system_id', doc="System identifier")
00633 @default_property('plugin_data', doc="Plugin private data")
00634 class TargetPort(IData):
00635     SUPPORTED_SEARCH_KEYS = ['id', 'system_id']
00636 
00637     TYPE_OTHER = 1
00638     TYPE_FC = 2
00639     TYPE_FCOE = 3
00640     TYPE_ISCSI = 4
00641 
00642     def __init__(self, _id, _port_type, _service_address,
00643                  _network_address, _physical_address, _physical_name,
00644                  _system_id, _plugin_data=None):
00645         self._id = _id
00646         self._port_type = _port_type
00647         self._service_address = _service_address
00648         # service_address:
00649         #   The address used by upper layer like FC and iSCSI:
00650         #       FC and FCoE:    WWPN
00651         #       iSCSI:          IQN
00652         #   String. Lower case, split with : every two digits if WWPN.
00653         self._network_address = _network_address
00654         # network_address:
00655         #   The address used by network layer like FC and TCP/IP:
00656         #       FC/FCoE:        WWPN
00657         #       iSCSI:          IPv4:Port
00658         #                       [IPv6]:Port
00659         #   String. Lower case, split with : every two digits if WWPN.
00660         self._physical_address = _physical_address
00661         # physical_address:
00662         #   The address used by physical layer like FC-0 and MAC:
00663         #       FC:             WWPN
00664         #       FCoE:           WWPN
00665         #       iSCSI:          MAC
00666         #   String. Lower case, split with : every two digits.
00667         self._physical_name = _physical_name
00668         # physical_name
00669         #   The name of physical port. Administrator could use this name to
00670         #   locate the port on storage system.
00671         #   String.
00672         self._system_id = _system_id
00673         self._plugin_data = _plugin_data
00674 
00675 
00676 class Capabilities(IData):
00677     UNSUPPORTED = 0
00678     SUPPORTED = 1
00679 
00680     _NUM = 512              # Indicate the maximum capability integer
00681 
00682     _CAP_NUM_BEGIN = 20     # Indicate the first capability integer
00683

00744     FS_CHILD_DEPENDENCY_RM_SPECIFIC_FILES = 114

00747     EXPORT_AUTH = 120
00748     EXPORTS = 121
00749     EXPORT_FS = 122
00750     EXPORT_REMOVE = 123
00751     EXPORT_CUSTOM_PATH = 124
00752 
00753     POOLS_QUICK_SEARCH = 210
00754     VOLUMES_QUICK_SEARCH = 211
00755     DISKS_QUICK_SEARCH = 212
00756     ACCESS_GROUPS_QUICK_SEARCH = 213
00757     FS_QUICK_SEARCH = 214
00758     NFS_EXPORTS_QUICK_SEARCH = 215
00759     TARGET_PORTS = 216
00760     TARGET_PORTS_QUICK_SEARCH = 217
00761 
00762     DISKS = 220
00763     POOL_MEMBER_INFO = 221
00764     VOLUME_RAID_CREATE = 222
00765 
00766     def _to_dict(self):
00767         return {'class': self.__class__.__name__,
00768                 'cap': ''.join(['%02x' % b for b in self._cap])}
00769 
00770     def __init__(self, _cap=None):
00771         if _cap is not None:
00772             self._cap = bytearray(_cap.decode('hex'))
00773         else:
00774             self._cap = bytearray(Capabilities._NUM)
00775 
00776     def supported(self, capability):
00777         return self.get(capability) == Capabilities.SUPPORTED
00778 
00779     def get(self, capability):
00780         if capability >= len(self._cap):
00781             return Capabilities.UNSUPPORTED
00782         return self._cap[capability]
00783 
00784     @staticmethod
00785     def _lsm_cap_to_str_dict():
00786         """
00787         Return a dict containing all valid capability:
00788             integer => string name
00789         """
00790         lsm_cap_to_str_conv = dict()
00791         for c_str, c_int in Capabilities.__dict__.items():
00792             if type(c_str) == str and type(c_int) == int and \
00793                     c_str[0] != '_' and \
00794                     Capabilities._CAP_NUM_BEGIN <= c_int <= Capabilities._NUM:
00795                 lsm_cap_to_str_conv[c_int] = c_str
00796         return lsm_cap_to_str_conv
00797 
00798     def get_supported(self, all_cap=False):
00799         """
00800         Returns a hash of the supported capabilities in the form
00801         constant, name
00802         """
00803         all_caps = Capabilities._lsm_cap_to_str_dict()
00804 
00805         if all_cap:
00806             return all_caps
00807 
00808         rc = {}
00809         for i in all_caps.keys():
00810             if self._cap[i] == Capabilities.SUPPORTED:
00811                 if i in all_caps:
00812                     rc[i] = all_caps[i]
00813         return rc
00814 
00815     def set(self, capability, value=SUPPORTED):
00816         self._cap[capability] = value
00817 
00818     def enable_all(self):
00819         for i in range(len(self._cap)):
00820             self._cap[i] = Capabilities.SUPPORTED
00821

00824     #TODO Need some unit tests that encode/decode all the types with nested
00825     pass
